com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.validator.resolution.param
Class DeployResolutionParameter

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.ccl.soa.deploy.core.validator.resolution.param.DeployResolutionParameter
All Implemented Interfaces:
IDeployResolutionParameter
Direct Known Subclasses:
DeployResolutionObjectAttributeParameter
public class DeployResolutionParameter
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDeployResolutionParameter

Default implementation of the deploy resolution parameter interface.

Exposes a generic typed attribute value that must be provided to the resolution.

Constructor Summary

DeployResolutionParameter

public DeployResolutionParameter(IDeployParameterizedResolution resolution,
                                 java.lang.Class<?> type,
                                 java.lang.String name,
                                 java.lang.String description)
Construct a resolution parameter for a non-EMF type.

Parameters:
resolution - the resolution which is parameterized.
type - the non-EMF type of the parameter
name - the name of the parameter.
description - an optional description of the parameter (may be null).

setDefaultValue

public void setDefaultValue(java.lang.Object defaultValue)

If the parameter is not set, then getValue() will return the newly set default value.

Parameters:
defaultValue - the default value.

validate

public IStatus validate()
Description copied from interface: IDeployResolutionParameter
Validates the value of the parameter.

The parameter is bound to a resolution (IDeployResolutionParameter.getResolution()) which is bound to a status IDeployResolution.getDeployStatus()) which is bound to an object (IDeployStatus.getDeployObject()) contained in a topology (DeployModelObject.getTopology()).

The value is validated in the context of the resolution object, and topology.

Specified by:
validate in interface IDeployResolutionParameter
Returns:
the status of validating the proposed value (never null).

getValidValueDescriptors

public java.util.List<IDeployResolutionParameterValueDescriptor> getValidValueDescriptors()
Description copied from interface: IDeployResolutionParameter
Returns a list of valid value descritors for the parameter.

The list contains the values and their descriptions. The list may not be exclusive (use IDeployResolutionParameter.isValidValueListExclusive()) to determine if other values are permitted.

Specified by:
getValidValueDescriptors in interface IDeployResolutionParameter
Returns:
a list of valid values and their descriptions (never null).

addValidValueDescriptor

public void addValidValueDescriptor(IDeployResolutionParameterValueDescriptor descriptor)
Adds a possible value descriptor.

Parameters:
descriptor - a valid value descriptor.

addValidValue

public void addValidValue(java.lang.Object value)
Creates and adds a descriptor for the valid value.

Uses a null value descriptor, which results in a generated descriptor based on the value.

Parameters:
value - the valid value to be added.

isValidValueListExclusive

public boolean isValidValueListExclusive()
Description copied from interface: IDeployResolutionParameter
Check if other values in addition to the ones return by IDeployResolutionParameter.getValidValueDescriptors() are allowed.

Specified by:
isValidValueListExclusive in interface IDeployResolutionParameter
Returns:
true if users can set to additional values, false if only the valid values are valid choices.

setValidValueListExclusive

public void setValidValueListExclusive(boolean isExclusive)
Set the exclusivity of the valid value list.

Parameters:
isExclusive - true if the valid value list is exclusive, false otherwise.
